original_text: Title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as Federal Reserve chair. Description: Bush economic advisor Kevin Warsh is set to succeed Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve, President Trump announced Friday.. URL: https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-nominates-kevin-warsh-next-federal-reserve-chair-2026-1
ai_article:
President Trump has announced his nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as the chair of the Federal Reserve. Warsh, a former economic advisor to President Bush, is poised to take on this crucial role in shaping US monetary policy.

This nomination comes at a critical time for the Federal Reserve as they navigate economic challenges and uncertainties. Warsh's background and experience will be closely watched as he steps into this influential position.

For more details on this breaking news, please visit: https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-nominates-kevin-warsh-next-federal-reserve-chair-2026-1.

original_text: Title: Meta and Microsoft both blew their data center budgets last quarter. Wall Street is only mad at one of them.. ai_article:
In a surprising turn of events, both Meta and Microsoft have exceeded their data center budgets last quarter. However, Wall Street seems to be more focused on Microsoft's overspending compared to Meta's. The two Big Tech giants are investing heavily in their data center infrastructure, with Microsoft facing more scrutiny from analysts at the moment.

Despite both companies facing budget challenges, Microsoft's increased capital expenditures have raised concerns among investors. The tech industry is closely watching how these budget overruns will impact the companies' financial performance in the coming quarters.

original_text: Title: What to expect from January's Fed meeting as Powell faces looming DOJ probe. Description: The Federal Reserve will likely hold rates steady at its January meeting, even as Jerome Powell faces mounting pressure from Trump amid the DOJ probe.. URL: https://www.businessinsider.com/fed-meeting-what-to-expect-interest-rates-jerome-powell-2026-1
ai_article:
As investors eagerly await the Federal Reserve's upcoming January meeting, all eyes are on Chairman Jerome Powell as he navigates mounting pressure from President Trump amid a looming Department of Justice probe. Despite the uncertainty surrounding Powell's future, experts predict that the Fed will likely hold interest rates steady during this month's meeting.

The outcome of the meeting could have significant implications for various sectors of the stock market, including financials and technology. Investors are advised to stay informed and closely monitor any developments that may arise during the meeting.

To read more about what to expect from the January Fed meeting and how Powell's leadership could impact the market, check out the full article at: https://www.businessinsider.com/fed-meeting-what-to-expect-interest-rates-jerome-powell-2026-1.
